snippet: Once again, euro-zone leaders came up short in addressing the debt crisis. They need to turn from debt-deepening austerity to substantial public investment.
abstract: Editorial criticizes European finance ministers for again coming up short in addressing the debt crisis; contends their so-called 'firewall' plan does too little, too late, to keep crisis from spreading; urges European political and financial leaders to turn to substantial public investment to address the crisis, not further debt-deepening austerity measures.
lead_paragraph: Once again, euro-zone leaders came up short in addressing the debt crisis. They need to turn from debt-deepening austerity to substantial public investment.
